channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MN

item.title: Report X-2024021032
item.description:
Report X-2024021032

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-21T15:11:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-08
  • City: ROGERS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered damaged at NEWO 0701 on 2/5, but the person who performed the DPR elected to return it immediately without an ISF or HESS entry/disposition. Package was discovered 2/8 at MPGR 0553in a trailer during unload in its original packaging, wet and leaking more. HESS specialist placed it in a lined tote, brought it to the damage area, and moved it to the drain mats in the incoming damaged hazmat/LQ area. DescribePack: two bottles leaked due to loose caps. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in lined tote, moved to drain mats

item.title: Report X-2024020885
item.description:
Report X-2024020885

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-20T15:11:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-02
  • City: ROGERS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: damaged hazmat discovered on the inbound. The package received a van scan this morning, then hours later a driver placed a code 10 on it and left it behind at the station. someone placed it in a lined tote and brought it to the damage area, moving it to the drain mats in the incoming damaged hazmat/LQ area. someone then placed a code 39 on the package with the note "pending inspection." no information was provided to outbound personnel about details not already covered. DescribePack: one bottle leaked from vented cap due to improper handling. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in lined tote, moved to drain mats

item.title: Report X-2024020390
item.description:
Report X-2024020390

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T15:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-18
  • City: SAINT PAUL
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package came from another station and was loaded upside down (opposite of indication arrows). Package was then found to have a loose cap on one of the bottles that was contained in the shipment. DescribePack: Loose cap on one of the bottles DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Was turned right side up, and then put into a tote to help make sure nothing else leaked from it

item.title: Report X-2024020656
item.description:
Report X-2024020656

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T15:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-24
  • City: ROGERS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: sometime yesterday afternoon the damaged package fell onto its side and leaked. someone placed it in a lined tote, brought it to the damage area, and moved it to the drain mats in the incoming damaged hazmat/LQ area. in-house cleanup, awaiting disposition. DescribePack: one bottle leaked from the cap, staining the label of the other bottle. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: placed in lined tote, moved to drain mats

item.title: Report X-2024020439
item.description:
Report X-2024020439

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T00:33:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-22
  • City: STEWARTVILLE
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found leaking on the rollers. It was then taken to the hazmat cage for inspection. DescribePack: One bottle in the package leaked out from the cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Taken off of the rollers and into a drum, then brought to the hazmat cage
